info.title: Quotes
info.description: These APIs allow clients to create and delete quotes, retrieve quote data, update, approve, or edit quotes, and so on.  On top of the actions used for managing the quote itself, it is also possible to retrieve quote revisions or different entities related to the quote or the generated documents pertaining to a specific quote. In addition, these APIs allow adding, deleting, or editing the items in the quote. These APIs are used in a variety of integrations between SAP applications and represent a standard to be used in any future integrations of the SAP Configure Price Quote quote with other applications.

x-sap-shortText: Allows you to successfully integrate and manage the Quote 2.0 engine.

externalDocs.description: Complete documentation on SAP Configure Price Quote

parameters.name: quoteId
parameters.description: Id of Quote where attachment is located

post.summary: Executes the action (either standard or custom, both are supported).

200.description: New revision and New active revision actions return the NewQuoteId and other actions return an empty response.

get.summary: Gets available standard and custom actions for the quote.

post.description:
If MarketId is not provided, the system will resolve MarketId based on provided MarketCode and CurrencyCode, if none are provided, the default market will be used for the logged in user. CustomerId takes priority over CustomerCode so if both are provided, the system disregards the CustomerCode and looks for the customer based on the CustomerId. Customer RoleType accepts 1 for billto customer, 2 for shipto customer, and 3 for enduser.
PricebookId takes priority over DistributionChannel so if both are provided, the system disregards the DistributionChannel and looks for the pricebook based on the PricebookId. SAP CPQ looks for the pricebook with the respective DistributionChannel in the market provided in MarketId.

get.summary: Get collaboration comments for the quote.

post.summary: Post collaboration comments for the quote.

parameters.name: quoteFields
parameters.description: Quote fields (standard and/or custom) to patch

parameters.name: customerFields
parameters.description: Quote fields (standard and/or custom) to patch

get.summary: Get the items from the quote.

post.description: If both PartNumber and ProductSystemId are provided, the system disregards the PartNumber and looks for the item based on the ProductSystemId as this field takes priority.

get.summary: Get the specific item from the quote.

200.description: Get rows of quote table with pagination

post.summary: Inserts new row in quote table.

patch.summary: Updates single row in quote table.

200.description: Get number of rows in quote table

get.summary: Get the items count from the quote.
Gets available actions for quote item.

post.summary: Invokes selected actions on quote item
